Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • Book
  • class Book
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a book, which has a title, author, year of publication and different literary aspects.
    Version:
    16/8/20
    Author:
    Bar Melinarskiy

      Returns a string representation of the book, which is a sequence of the title, author, year of publication and the total literary value of the book, separated by commas, inclosed in square brackets.

      • Book

        Book​(java.lang.String bookTitle,
     java.lang.String bookAuthor,
     int bookYearOfPublication,
     int bookComicValue,
     int bookDramaticValue,
     int bookEducationalValue)
        Creates a new book with the given characteristic.
        Parameters:
        bookTitle - The title of the book.
        bookAuthor - The name of the author of the book.
        bookYearOfPublication - The year the book was published.
        bookComicValue - The comic value of the book.
        bookDramaticValue - The dramatic value of the book.
        bookEducationalValue - The educational value of the book.

    • Method Detail

      • stringRepresentation

        java.lang.String stringRepresentation()
        Returns a string representation of the book, which is a sequence of the title, author, year of publication and the total literary value of the book, separated by commas, inclosed in square brackets. For example, if the book is titled "Monkey Feet", was written by Ernie Douglas, published in 1987 and has a comic value of 7, dramatic value of 3 and an educational value of 1, this method will return the string: "[MonkeyFeet,Ernie Douglas,1987,11]"
        Returns:
        the String representation of this book.

      • getLiteraryValue

        int getLiteraryValue()
        Returns:
        the literary value of this book, which is defined as the sum of its comic value, its dramatic value and its educational value.

      • setBorrowerId

        void setBorrowerId​(int borrowerId)
        Sets the given id as the id of the current borrower of this book, -1 if no patron is currently borrowing it.
        Parameters:
        borrowerId - the id of the current borrower of this book

      • getCurrentBorrowerId

        int getCurrentBorrowerId()
        Returns:
        the id of the current borrower of this book.

      • returnBook

        void returnBook()
        Marks this book as returned.
